text: Thomas Allen Schwartz (born March 7, 1945)http://www.defense.gov/releases/release.aspx?releaseid=662 is a retired United States Army four-star general who commanded the United States Army Forces Command from 1998 to 1999 and United States Forces Korea from 1999 to 2002. ==Education== Schwartz attended Cretin High School (now Cretin-Derham Hall High School) in Saint Paul, Minnesota. ==Military career== Schwartz was born on March 7, 1945, in St. Paul, Minnesota.General Officer Announcement 583-95 October 31, 1995 He was commissioned in the infantry following graduation from the United States Military Academy in 1967. He served as a platoon leader and company commander with the 2nd Battalion, 505th Infantry in Vietnam from August 1968 to October 1969, earning both a Silver Star and a Purple Heart.New Chairman Aims to Help More Mobile Military Children In addition to Forces Command and U.S. Forces Korea, Schwartz has also commanded III Corps and the 4th Infantry Division from October 1993 to November 1995.4th Infantry Division, Division Commanders Schwartz holds master's degrees from Duke University and the Naval War College.USFK Assumption of Command notice He is also a graduate of the Infantry Officer organization co-founded by his wife Sandy and other military spouses.
